intro: Horkelia bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Horkelia bolanderi is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in areas with limited soil moisture.
